solution_line_template: First, we need to find the total number of miles Tony will be driving by adding {groceries_miles}+{haircut_miles}+{doctors_miles}=<<{groceries_miles}+{haircut_miles}+{doctors_miles}={total_miles}>>{total_miles} miles in total.

To determine the halfway point, we simply divide the total number of miles by {halfway_divisor}, performing {total_miles}/{halfway_divisor}=<<{total_miles}/{halfway_divisor}={halfway_miles}>>{halfway_miles} miles driven when Tony is halfway done.
